results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Hospitals;Medical Devices;Microbiology;Cameras;Digestive Tract;Food and Drug Administration;Olympus Corp;United States
results.title: These Devices Sickened Hundreds. The New Models Have Risks, Too.
results.abstract: Duodenoscopes — tubular cameras threaded into the intestine — with disposable parts were supposed to be safer. But the parts can fall off in the body, the F.D.A. warned.

media.caption: Duodenoscopes, which enter the upper part of the small intestine through the mouth to diagnose and treat diseases of the pancreas and the bile duct, are used in about 500,000 procedures a year in the U.S.

results.adx_keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces;Military Bases and Installations;Names, Geographical;Pickett, George E;Barfoot, Van;United States Army;Defense Department;Fort Pickett (Va);Fort Barfoot (Va);Confederate States of America
results.title: Army Base Renamed for Native American War Hero, Replacing Confederate
results.abstract: In the first of nine scheduled redesignations, Fort Pickett in Virginia became Fort Barfoot in honor of Col. Van Barfoot, a Medal of Honor recipient.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: From left, Margaret Nicholls, Col. Van Barfoot’s daughter; Senator Tim Kaine; and Tom Barfoot, Colonel Barfoot’s son, unveiling a sign with the new name of the fort in Blackstone, Va.
media.copyright: Parker Michels-Boyce for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Elderly;Immune System;Food and Drug Administration
results.title: Should You Get Another Covid Booster?
results.abstract: Britain and Canada have authorized another round of booster shots for older and immunocompromised citizens. So far, U.S. officials haven’t followed suit.

media.caption: A woman receiving a fourth shot in September in Phoenix. While a Covid infection can be a matter of inconvenience for some, it can spell severe disease, hospitalization and death for older adults and immunocompromised people.
media.copyright: Ash Ponders for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Cemeteries;Parks and Other Recreation Areas;Deaths (Fatalities);Morgues and Mortuaries;Hart Island (Bronx, NY)
results.title: A Million Bodies Are Buried Here. Now It’s Becoming a Park.
results.abstract: Hart Island, a potter’s field where New York City has buried its unclaimed dead for more than a century, will finally accept visitors this year.

media.caption: The city still conducts about 1,100 burials every year on Hart Island, adding to the million bodies already buried there. The graves will remain undisturbed as Hart Island is opened to the public.

results.adx_keywords: Wildlife Die-Offs;Fish and Other Marine Life;Agriculture and Farming;Murray-Darling Basin (Australia);Australia
results.byline: By Yan Zhuang and Michaela Skovranova
results.title: A River Choking on Fish Corpses, and a Community Full of Anger
results.abstract: It’s the latest clash over a river basin in New South Wales, Australia, in an arid land where social, economic and environmental interests collide over water issues.

media.caption: Millions of dead fish floating along parts of the lower Darling River in Menindee, Australia, on Wednesday.

results.adx_keywords: Campaign Finance;Lobbying and Lobbyists;Elections, District Attorneys;United States Politics and Government;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Anti-Semitism;Bragg, Alvin;Soros, George;Trump, Donald J;Color of Change (Nonprofit)
results.title: Explaining the Ties Between Alvin Bragg and George Soros
results.abstract: Donald Trump’s allies have accused the district attorney bringing a case against him as having been “bought” by Mr. Soros, the philanthropist. That is misleading, though the men do have a financial connection.

media.caption: Alvin L. Bragg, left, the Manhattan district attorney, received support in his 2021 campaign from a group backed by George Soros, the billionaire philanthropist.
media.copyright: Karsten Moran for The New York Times; Ronald Zak/Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Long Covid;Chronic Condition (Health);Research;Diabetes;Vaccination and Immunization;Obesity;your-feed-healthcare;JAMA Internal Medicine (Journal)
results.title: Who Is Most at Risk for Long Covid?
results.abstract: A new analysis summarizes the emerging picture of factors that make long-term post-Covid symptoms more likely.

media.caption: A patient living with long Covid since her infection in March 2020 in Massachusetts. The analysis involved a total of 860,783 patients and found patients were more likely to be female.

results.adx_keywords: Traffic Accidents and Safety;Deaths (Fatalities);Roads and Traffic;Baltimore County (Md);Maryland;Woodlawn (Md)
results.byline: By Johnny Diaz and Eduardo Medina
results.title: Driver Strikes Highway Workers in Maryland, Killing 6
results.abstract: The six workers, including two brothers from El Salvador and a father and son, were pronounced dead after they were struck on Interstate 695 outside Baltimore, the authorities said.

media.caption: The authorities said the driver of an Acura struck the highway workers as she tried to change lanes on Interstate 695 in Woodlawn, Md., on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Jerry Jackson/The Baltimore Sun, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Explosions (Accidental);Fires and Firefighters;Factories and Manufacturing;internal-storyline-no;RM Palmer Co;West Reading (Pa)
results.title: Chocolate Factory Explosion in Pennsylvania Leaves Two Dead and Nine Missing
results.abstract: Eight people were also taken to a hospital after the explosion at the R.M. Palmer Company chocolate factory in West Reading, Pa., on Friday, officials said.

media.caption: A still from a video shows the moments after an explosion that destroyed part of the R.M. Palmer Company chocolate factory in West Reading, Pa.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Fashion and Apparel;Fentanyl;Lady Gaga;Gallagher, Kathryn Marie (1986-2022);Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York;Manhattan (NYC)
results.title: Overdose Death of Designer Who Dressed Lady Gaga Is Ruled a Homicide
results.abstract: Kathryn Marie Gallagher, 35, whose body was found in her apartment in July, died from a lethal mix of fentanyl and alcohol, the New York City medical examiner said.
org_facet: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York

media.caption: Kathryn Gallagher, inspired by girlhood days in the woods, cultivated a Gothic aesthetic.

results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Alan Feuer, Ben Protess and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Court Action Underscores Peril for Trump in Documents Investigation
results.abstract: Federal prosecutors continue to build a case that the former president obstructed efforts by the government to reclaim classified material and that he may have misled his own lawyer.

media.caption: Recent court actions have indicated that prosecutors have continued to construct a case around former President Donald J. Trump’s handling of classified documents.

results.adx_keywords: Customs, Etiquette and Manners;Content Type: Service
results.title: My New Boyfriend Offered to Pay Off My Credit Card Debt. Help!
results.abstract: A reader doing battle with 25 percent annual interest is tempted by her boyfriend’s offer of an interest-free loan, but she worries it may be inappropriate to accept.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Politics and Government;Elections, Governors;Supreme Courts (State);Lake, Kari A;Hobbs, Kathleen M;Republican Party;Arizona;Maricopa County (Ariz)
results.title: Arizona Supreme Court Turns Down Kari Lake’s Appeal in Her Election Lawsuit
results.abstract: The justices refused to hear Ms. Lake’s claims disputing her loss in the governor’s race, but sent one part of her lawsuit back to a trial court for review.

media.caption: Kari Lake, a Republican who was defeated by Katie Hobbs in the Arizona governor’s race last fall, had made false election claims the centerpiece of her campaign.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;your-feed-health;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Autism;Children and Childhood;Disabilities;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;United States
results.title: Autism Prevalence Rises Again, Study Finds
results.abstract: The pandemic may have disrupted the detection of autism spectrum disorder in young children, researchers also reported.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: The rise in autism’s prevalence could stem from several factors, including increased awareness and screening.

results.title: ‘Bad Cinderella’ Review: The Title Warned Us
results.abstract: Andrew Lloyd Webber hopes to extend an unbroken 43-year streak on Broadway. But his 13th new musical may not be the charm.

media.caption: Jordan Dobson, left, as Prince Sebastian and Linedy Genao as Cinderella in the musical “Bad Cinderella” at the Imperial Theater in Manhattan.

results.title: Once the World’s Largest, a Hotel Goes ‘Poof!’ Before Our Eyes
results.abstract: The Hotel Pennsylvania in Manhattan was a virtual city within a city. But in the end, nothing could save it.

results.title: Katherine Schwarzenegger Pratt’s Picture-Perfect Life
results.abstract: The author has long been surrounded by fame. Still, she keeps some things private.

results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Jonah E. Bromwich and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump, Escalating Attacks, Raises Specter of Violence if He Is Charged
results.abstract: In an overnight post, the former president warned of “potential death and destruction” if he was indicted. Hours later, the Manhattan district attorney’s office received a threatening letter.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump, who is again campaigning for the White House, has called the investigation a politically motivated “witch hunt.”

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Sex Crimes;Jury System;Carroll, E Jean;Trump, Donald J;Manhattan (NYC)
results.title: In Trump Rape Case, Jurors Will Be Kept Anonymous to Protect Them
results.abstract: A judge said that they could become victims of “harassment or worse” from supporters of the former president as he faces a lawsuit by the writer E. Jean Carroll.

media.caption: E. Jean Carroll has said Donald J. Trump attacked her in a department-store dressing room and later defamed her.

results.adx_keywords: Sharks;Academic and Scientific Journals;Research;Toys;Water Pollution;Plastics;your-feed-science;Mediterranean Marine Science (Journal);Mediterranean Sea;Greece
results.title: A Shark Discovery ‘Didn’t Look Right.’ It Might Have Been a Plastic Toy.
results.abstract: Scientists have retracted a study that showed a rare goblin shark washed up on a Greek beach after other researchers voiced doubts about the find.

media.caption: A comparison of the goblin shark specimen found by a citizen scientist on the island of Anafi in Greece, top, and a juvenile female found in waters off Japan.
